meanings.definition: A person or thing that hatches, especially eggs.
meanings.sent1: The mother bird was one of the best hatchers in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The incubator is a helpful tool for hatchers of chicken eggs.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox tried to disguise itself as a hatcher to steal the eggs.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a hatcher of brilliant ideas, always bringing forth new thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The diligent hen was a master hatcher, carefully tending to her eggs until they hatched.

meanings.definition: A device for hatching eggs artificially.
meanings.sent1: The automatic hatcher in the farm helps speed up the egg hatching process.
meanings.sent2: The hatcher maintains the perfect temperature and humidity for the eggs to hatch.
meanings.sent3: The robotic hatcher beeped happily as the eggs began to crack open.
meanings.sent4: The machine hummed softly, acting as a mechanical hatcher for the bird eggs.
meanings.sent5: The high-tech hatcher was a marvel of modern egg hatching technology.

meanings.definition: A person who hatches plots or schemes.
meanings.sent1: The villain was known as a notorious hatcher of evil plans.
meanings.sent2: The spy was a skilled hatcher, always coming up with clever schemes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended to be a hatcher of secret missions in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a fertile hatcher of devious plots, always thinking of new ways to cause trouble.
meanings.sent5: The mastermind behind the heist was a cunning hatcher, orchestrating the entire operation.
